Address.college_name: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1951 as Kumasi College of Technology, acquired present status and title 1998.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE), Ordinary ('O') level, with 5 credits, including English, and General Certificate of Education Advanced ('A') level, with 2 passes
Senior Secondary School Certificate (SSCE) with passes in core English and Mathematics and three elective subjects relevant to chosen programme with a total aggregate of 24

Senior Secondary School Certificate; State Registered Nurses Certificate; Higher National Diploma/Diploma holders; West Africa Senior Secondary School Certificate; Mature Applicants and Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1962 as University College of Cape Coast, acquired present status and title 1971.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1948 as University College of the Gold Coast affiliated to the University of London, became University of Ghana after independence in 1957, and acquired present status and title in 1961
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) with 5 credits including English, Mathematics, Arts and Science or West Africa School Certificate (WASC) Ordinary ('O') level and three passes at Advanced ('A') level, with a minimum grade D for one
Senior Secondary School Certificate with passes in core English, Mathematics and any 3 elective subjects, with aggregate score of 24 in the WAEC entrance examination

Senior Secondary Certificate: Passes in four core subjects, namely English, Mathematics, Science or Integrated Science and Social Studies or Life Skills and any three relevant elective subjects, with an aggregate score of not more than 24 in the WAEC Senior Secondary School Certificate Examinations
